name: Ajanta Caves
description: Buddhist rock-cut caves with murals and sculptures from 2nd century BCE to 6th century CE. The Ajanta paintings depict Jataka tales and Buddhist themes.

name: Sanchi Stupa
description: A 3rd century BCE Buddhist stupa famous for its sculptural gateways and carvings depicting scenes from Buddha's life.

name: Ellora Caves
description: A complex of 34 rock-cut temples from 5th to 10th century CE, featuring Buddhist, Hindu, and Jain art. Known for Kailasa temple, the largest monolithic rock excavation in the world.

name: Brihadeeswarar Temple
description: Built in the 11th century in Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu, it features massive Dravidian architecture and intricate frescoes of Chola art.

name: Khajuraho Temples
description: Famous for medieval Hindu and Jain temples with elaborate erotic sculptures and carvings from 10th–12th century CE.

name: Tanjore Paintings
description: Richly adorned paintings from Tamil Nadu, 16th–18th centuries, often featuring Hindu deities in vibrant colors with gold foil.

name: Jaipur Miniature Art
description: Rajasthani miniature paintings with intricate details, vibrant colors, and depiction of royal life during the 17th–19th centuries.

name: Delhi Mughal Art
description: Mughal-era architecture and paintings blending Persian and Indian styles, highlighting court scenes, floral patterns, and portraiture.

name: Contemporary Street Art, Mumbai
description: Modern urban art scene featuring murals and graffiti in Mumbai’s streets, showcasing Indian culture, social themes, and modern artistic expression.

name: Kharagpur Folk Art
description: Traditional West Bengal folk art, including Patachitra painting on cloth, celebrating mythological tales and village life in modern adaptations.
